text: Presidential elections happened in France on 24 April and 8 May 1988. In 1981, the Socialist Party leader, François Mitterrand, was elected President of France and the Left won the legislative election. However, in 1986, the right regained a parliamentary majority. ==Other websites== * Radio-TV debate Jacques Chirac/François Mitterrand * Announcement of the result of the second round, on TV Category:1980s in France Category:1988 elections Category:Presidential elections in France
title: 1988 French presidential election
